author: Special Correspondent
text:
About 2,800 teachers affiliated to Joint Action Council of Teachers Organisations courted arrest on their third day of strike highlighting their charter of demands.

The teachers raised slogans criticising the State Government for not withdrawing the new pension policy and for not extending the privileges of Sixth Pay Commission on par with their Central Government counterparts.

They were all arrested at the Kaalai Maadu Junction area, and released later in the day. The protest affected functioning of schools substantially, sources said.
title: 2,800 arrested in Erode
